Package assignment.test.util

Class OutputExcelHandler

java.lang.Object
edu.ccri.assignment.files.poi.AbstractPoiWriteElementDataList
assignment.test.util.OutputExcelHandler
public class OutputExcelHandler extends edu.ccri.assignment.files.poi.AbstractPoiWriteElementDataList
This class contains static methods that handle writing output data to an Excel file.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static Boolean
    checkDirectory()
    Checks if the directory is full.

    A directory is considered full if all 21 possible filenames exist in the directory (ProcessedData1, ProcessedData2, ..., ProcessedData21).

    • getUniqueID

      private static int getUniqueID() throws FileNotFoundException
      Checks if the output directory is full using the checkDirectory() method. If the directory is full, a FileNotFoundException is thrown. If the directory is not full, a unique filename ID is generated and returned using the getFile() method.
      Returns:
      a unique filename ID that does not already exist in the output directory
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the directory is full

    • getFile

      private static int getFile()
      Generates a unique filename ID using Random and ensures it does not already exist in the output directory.
      Returns:
      a unique filename ID that does not already exist in the output directory

    • checkDirectory

      public static Boolean checkDirectory()
      Checks if the directory is full.

      A directory is considered full if all 21 possible filenames exist in the directory (ProcessedData1, ProcessedData2, ..., ProcessedData21).
      Returns:
      true if the directory is full, false otherwise
